intro: Cheilanthes lepida, commonly known as the slender rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, compact growth habit and is often found growing on rocky substrates in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has finely divided, linear leaves that are usually dark green and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. It is a perennial plant that can thrive in low-nutrient soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Cheilanthes lepida is widely distributed across North America and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
